greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Real part of the product of all the integer complex numbers in the square [1,1] to [n,n].
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..27
example: For n = 2, we have (1 + i)(1 + 2i)(2 + i)(2 + 2i) which gives -20 + 0i, so a(2) = -20.
mathematica: Table[Re[Times@@Flatten[Table[a + b I, {a, n}, {b, n}]]], {n, 20}] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 04 2014 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = real(prod(i=1, n, prod(j=1, n, i+I*j))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 27 2013
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Dec 26 2013
